dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Resistivity Sensor
levelledPara.para: The resistivity sensor (RS-1611G) (refer to ) is used to verify feed water quality. The resistivity sensor transmits a status signal to the process controller. The status signal is conditioned and used by the process controller to determine the need to flush the feed water system. The process controller initiates one message (refer to Appendix B, table B-1), FS088 indicating the resistivity is less than 0.5 Mohms-cm.

levelledPara.title: Resistivity Sensor
levelledPara.para: (Refer to Resistivity sensor (RS-1611G) is used to verify the quality of the water leaving the DI bed (DIB-623G) by measuring resistivity. The GGS requires the resistivity of the water to be greater than 0.5 Mohms-cm. The process controller will flush water not meeting this criteria to the clean water bilge tank by activating solenoid valve SV-627G, and if the water exceeds 0.5 Mohms for greater than 30 seconds the system will shut down.
The stainless steel resistivity sensor and adapter are mounted in manifold M130 for ease of maintenance.
